intro: Saccolabium chrysoplectrum var. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower screwbean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped pods. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
